result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
9:20 AM Defendant Anthony T Whittley in court, in custody.  Attorney Ronald James Sonderhouse in court for Anthony T Whittley.  Plaintiff State of Wisconsin in court.  Attorney Randy Sitzberger in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Atty. Sonderhouse states the defendant wishes to be appointed new counsel.  Defendant requests to be appointed new counsel and waives the time limits for the preliminary hearing.  Bail remains as fixed. Atty. Sitzberger states the public defender's office has had a hard time locating counsel.  Witness states his wife is due in two weeks.  Defendant inquires if he will be at Dodge Correctional before the next hearing. 
 Defendant requests preliminary hearing to be set within 10 days.  Court informs defendant of his rights for setting the preliminary hearing.  Court sets preliminary hearing within 10 days from today.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Preliminary hearing on November 14, 2022 at 09:15 am.
To Seal Victim/Witness Identification Key signed by Judge J. Arthur Melvin on 10/25/2022.

ADDRESS INFO for Anthony T Whittley
Current: c/o Waukesha County Jail, 515 W Moreland blvd, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 10-25-2022)
Prior: 4930 W Nash St, Milwaukee, WI 53216
Preliminary hearing on November 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference on November 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed. Defendant not to possess any drug paraphernalia. Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol. Defendant not to leave the State of Wisconsin without prior authorization from the Court. If the defendant has a passport he is to surrender his passport to the Waukesha Criminal Traffic Office (Room C226) within 24 hours of release from custody. Defendant is not permitted to apply for the issuance,  duplicate nor renewal of a passport and/or passport card during the pendency of this action. Defendant is not to possess any dangerous weapons/firearms/knives. Defendant to have no contact with Victim A listed in the Criminal Complaint/Victim Identification Key with the exception of emergency purposes or if Victim A initiates contact. Defendant is not to share, reproduce or distribute any personal and/or identifying information about the crime victim(s), except to their attorney.

3:01 PM Defendant Anthony T Whittley in court, in custody. District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin by Julian Marrufo. Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint. Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties. Court advises of right to an attorney. The State argues Count 2 of the criminal complaint. Attorney Gutierrez is requesting to dismiss Count 2 of the criminal complaint and makes arguments in support of his request. The Court will dismiss Count 2. Preliminary Hearing requested. PRELIMINARY HEARING REQUESTED WITHIN 10 DAYS.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for November 4, 2022 at 09:15 am.
Status conference scheduled for November 3, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Waukesha County Public Safety Assessment Report filed by Wisconsin Community Services.
Victim/Witness Identification Key filed, under seal, by the District Attorney's office.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
